# Holme Valley War Memorial

Holme Valley War Memorial is a war memorial in the grounds of the Holme Valley Memorial Hospital Holmfirth, West Yorkshire, in England. It was unveiled in July 1921, by Colonel H. R. Headlam (Rtd), who had previously commanded the 5th Battalion, Duke of Wellingtonâ€™s West Riding Regiment.
The memorial consists of a simple cross with the names of fallen soldiers inscribed on it.
File:Holme Valley Memorial Hospital- names (right) (geograph 4797191).jpg|Names behind cross, on right
File:Holme Valley Memorial Hospital- names (left) (geograph 4797195).jpg|Names behind cross, on left
